title: btc-room101
author: btc-room101
content: https://github.com/room101-dev/Grand-Ultimate-BTC-Hacker/projects?query=is%3Aopen&type=classicNew hardware usb random generators are showing great accomplishments in using these monster bloom-filter baby-step/giant-step hacking system where on each cycle all the entire known btc high value addresses ( all 300M ) are compared on each cycle;Problem in the past has been the weak pseudo random number generators for 'first guess', but now using /dev/random USB HW devices that cost less that $40 and or can be made for penny's using avalanche diodes on USB chips can lead ML system to first guess address to private-key translations and then iterative searchesGiven 1,000's of private keys per hours on each RTX-3080 ( 5,000 Billion * 300M BTC address compares per cycle ), even old 2gb GPU nvidia cards can do a 300M * 300M comps which is close to a trillion comps on each cycle, not uncommon to find one lost bitcoin address pair per day on a common GPU rack;

comments.author: n0nce
comments.body: Why exactly did you just create 2 threads for the same topic?And your link just shows old projects updated in 2021. Do you have more information on these measurements, results and about the USB RNGs?

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: I would be very careful clicking on, running, or downloading anything that this user suggests or talks about. For anyone interested in trying out any software he recommends, please take a look at OP's trust feedback and figure out if that's a person you could trust.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: btc-room101 on December 01, 2022, 01:18:09 PMGiven 1,000's of private keys per hours on each RTX-3080 ( 5,000 Billion * 300M BTC address compares per cycle ), even old 2gb GPU nvidia cards can do a 300M * 300M comps which is close to a trillion comps on each cycle, not uncommon to find one lost bitcoin address pair per day on a common GPU rack;"Uncommon" is the chance of matching one of  40 million out of 2160 in a trillion tries, you know how many zeros after dot and zero that is?Quoteyou got 10e36, divide that by 10e15, and you get 10e15I'm pretty sure math doesn't work that way..Quotethat many seconds tells you how often you should have a hit in real time, Just 316880878.14 Years, no biggie!

comments.author: citb0in
comments.body: whatever you click on his repository under his advertised "Projects" outputs the messageQuoteThis project doesn’t have any columns or cards.looks like he wrote some amazing terms and texts under "projects" to dazzle people or maybe attract victims. According to his repository here, he seems to be the ultimate hero ever who can crack anything starting with B and ending with n.But maybe I'm wrong and he was Satoshis' teacher

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: You yourself wrote in the Github that these cards have a 600 MB (contiguous?) storage allocation limitation. So how did you manage to allocate 5 of these pools and multiplex between them, all while preserving device performance?

comments.author: WanderingPhilospher
comments.body: I just stumbled across this second thread of the same topic.My question is this:Quotethe entire known btc high value addresses ( all 300M )Where are there 300M high value addresses? Shoot, where are there 300 million addresses (with balances) period...

comments.body: Quote from: WanderingPhilospher on February 03, 2023, 06:22:47 PMNo, I did not need that LOL...find me 300 million funded addresses on that list, and then find me 300 million that are high value...LOL, just realized what you mean. comments.author: DaveF
comments.created_time: February 04, 2023, 12:08:57 AMLast edit: February 04, 2023, 02:33:45 AM by DaveF
comments.body: Quote from: franky1 on February 03, 2023, 09:31:16 PM...i still wonder where he gets his 300m from...Same place that he gets everything else from, he makes it up as he goes.Just comes and posts shit trying to get attention.I do believe this says it all: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=2038954Quote from: franky1 on February 03, 2023, 09:31:16 PM..but even then.. its still a project even passed down from parent to child for 1000 generations. wont get you results in first generation of inheritors(unless someone used bad RND in their vanity gen to create their address..Speak for yourself, I'm going to live forever.....or die trying.-Dave
